byline.original: By MARY WILLIAMS WALSH and MICHAEL CORKERY

abstract: Deal involving Puerto Rico's Coco Beach Golf Club offers insight into role Government Investment Bank played in miring island in billions of dollars of debt; golf resort was subsidized by federal taxpayers and backed by bank, but then project went bankrupt, allowing new owner OHorizons Global to to acquire it for mere $2.2 million, leaving bank with all of debt.
lead_paragraph: Much of the $72 billion in debt the island cannot repay stems from loans extended and guaranteed by its Government Development Bank

headline.main: Behind Puerto Rico’s Woes, a Broadly Powerful Development Bank
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rican Bank Left Debt, Not Development

snippet: Much of the $72 billion in debt the island cannot repay stems from loans extended and guaranteed by its Government Development Bank
